quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: What is the first business of one who practices philosophy? To get rid of self-conceit. For it is impossible for anyone to begin to learn that which he thinks he already knows.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.

quotesArray.author: Epictetus
quotesArray.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

quotesArray.author: Dr. Seuss
quotesArray.quote: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.

quotesArray.author: Dr. Seuss
quotesArray.quote: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple.

quotesArray.author: J.K. Rowling
quotesArray.quote: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all.

quotesArray.author: J.K. Rowling
quotesArray.quote: If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.

quotesArray.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

quotesArray.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.

quotesArray.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: Never mistake knowledge for wisdom. One helps you make a living; the other helps you make a life.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: ′Classic′ - a book which people praise and don't read.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.

quotesArray.author: Mark Twain
quotesArray.quote: The secret to getting ahead is getting started.

quotesArray.author: Oscar Wilde
quotesArray.quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.

quotesArray.author: Oscar Wilde
quotesArray.quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.

quotesArray.author: Oscar Wilde
quotesArray.quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.

quotesArray.author: Oscar Wilde
quotesArray.quote: A good friend will always stab you in the front.

quotesArray.author: Oscar Wilde
quotesArray.quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.

quotesArray.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotesArray.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

quotesArray.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotesArray.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.

quotesArray.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotesArray.quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.

quotesArray.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotesArray.quote: A pessimist is a man who thinks everybody is as nasty as himself, and hates them for it.

quotesArray.author: Theodore Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.

quotesArray.author: Theodore Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: To educate a person in the mind but not in morals is to educate a menace to society.

quotesArray.author: Theodore Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: Knowing what's right doesn't mean much unless you do what's right.

quotesArray.author: Theodore Roosevelt
quotesArray.quote: No man needs sympathy because he has to work, because he has a burden to carry. Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.

quotesArray.author: Alexandre Dumas fils
quotesArray.quote: The difference between genius and stupidity is: genius has its limits.

quotesArray.author: Yogi Berra
quotesArray.quote: The future ain’t what it used to be.

quotesArray.author: Yogi Berra
quotesArray.quote: You can observe a lot by just watching.

quotesArray.author: Yogi Berra
quotesArray.quote: It ain’t over till it’s over.

quotesArray.author: Plato
quotesArray.quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

quotesArray.author: Plato
quotesArray.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.

quotesArray.author: Plato
quotesArray.quote: Never discourage anyone...who continually makes progress, no matter how slow.

quotesArray.author: Plato
quotesArray.quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.

quotesArray.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotesArray.quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?

quotesArray.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotesArray.quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.

quotesArray.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotesArray.quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.

quotesArray.author: Abraham Lincoln
quotesArray.quote: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.

quotesArray.author: Albert Einstein
quotesArray.quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.

quotesArray.author: Albert Einstein
quotesArray.quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

quotesArray.author: Albert Einstein
quotesArray.quote: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.
